title: 112_s1382
content: The Act may be cited as the "Appalachian Development Highway System Act of 2011". It pertains to the Appalachian Development Highway System. Authorization of Appropriations: $1,080,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated for the Appalachian development highway system program annually from 2012 to 2017. The funds will be apportioned among states based on cost estimates by the Appalachian Regional Commission. The funds can be obligated similarly to those apportioned under Title 23 of the United States Code. The Federal share of project costs under the Appalachian development highway system program is determined by section 14501 of title 40, United States Code. Funds allocated for the program remain available until expended. Any obligation limitations for fiscal years 2012 through 2017 do not apply to funds authorized for the program. States may reallocate amounts for the Appalachian development highway system under section 14501 of title 40. The Appalachian development highway system funds unobligated by a State after 5 years will be returned to the Secretary and reallocated among other States. States can lend their apportioned funds to other eligible States for use in activities under the program. Any loan under paragraph (1) shall be repaid in accordance with a loan repayment agreement that is entered into by the affected States and agreed to by the Secretary. The funds authorized by this subsection shall be used to administer the provisions of law to be financed from appropriations for the Federal-aid highway program and programs authorized under chapter 2. In any case in which an apportionment is made of the amounts made available for expenditure for the Appalachian development highway system. The Secretary shall transfer up to $3,000,000 annually to the Appalachian Regional Commission for administrative and planning activities related to the Appalachian development highway system. Section 105 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by removing subparagraph (J) and redesignating subparagraphs (K) through (N) in the Equity Bonus Program. In section 105 of title 23, United States Code, subparagraphs (K) through (N) are redesignated as subparagraphs (J) through (M). Subparagraph (J) is struck and subparagraph (K) is redesignated as subparagraph (J) in subsection (b)(2).
